svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - August 28 2021
August 28 2021

title: "Week in Ethereum News
August 28, 2021" date: "2021-08-28"
Eth News and Links
Mainnet execution layer
â€¢ Consensus bug (CVE-2021-39137) exploited causing a small chain split for those who did not update their Geth nodes as instructed: Most
miners had already updated and the incorrect minority chain was short-lived Update now to Geth v1.10.8 and Erigon v2021.08.04 (or later)
Exploit explainer : pointer to contract's memory was overwritten (pointers are confusing) Impacts Geth based EVM networks (sidechains and
Layer2)
â€¢ Most miners had already updated and the incorrect minority chain was short-lived
â€¢ Update now to Geth v1.10.8 and Erigon v2021.08.04 (or later)
â€¢ Exploit explainer : pointer to contract's memory was overwritten (pointers are confusing)
â€¢ Impacts Geth based EVM networks (sidechains and Layer2)
â€¢ Geth removing deprecated RPC flags , update command line flags to use http instead
â€¢ 100,000 ETH burnt with EIP1559 since London upgrade
â€¢ Execution layer client teams granted $1.5 million from application layer projects (Compound Grants, Lido, Synthetix, The Graph and
Uniswap Grants) and Kraken, in addition to Ethereum Foundation funding
EIPs/Standards
â€¢ EIP3772 : Compressed Integers
â€¢ EIP3770 : Chain-specific addresses
â€¢ EIP3756 : Gas Limit Cap
â€¢ EIP3754 : Vanilla Non-Fungible Token Standard
â€¢ EIP3742 : Multi Party Contract Standard
Proof of stake consensus layer
â€¢ Stakers: you must update to the latest Geth or Erigon if you run them.Â Also be prepared for the Altair upgrade coming at the end of
September
â€¢ Beacon chain minor incident: Orphaned blocks caused small number of dropped attestations, resulting in a 1-2% drop in participation
Caused by Lido overreliance on one node serving the queries of 4000 validators Data driven investigation
â€¢ Orphaned blocks caused small number of dropped attestations, resulting in a 1-2% drop in participation
â€¢ Caused by Lido overreliance on one node serving the queries of 4000 validators
â€¢ Data driven investigation
â€¢ Danny Ryanâ€™s Finalized PoS update : Altair upgrade of Prater testnet on September 2, Beacon chain upgrade targeting end of September
â€¢ Latest Whatâ€™s New in Eth2
â€¢ PoS implementers call . Notes from Alex Stokes and Ben Edgington
â€¢ Teku v21.8.2 : Altair upgrade of Prater and reduced CPU and memory usage
â€¢ Lighthouse v1.5.1 : Altair upgrade of Prater, v1.5.0 improved networking stack and doppelganger protection, downgrade requires resync
â€¢ Nimbus privacy focus impacts crawlers as cycles libp2p peerid on restart and doesnâ€™t accept socket connection when peer table is full
â€¢ Proposal for committee-driven MEV smoothing to equally share a blockâ€™s MEV among the committee members and the proposer
â€¢ Predicted exit/entry queue clog once withdrawals enabled due to validators wanting to compound their stake and rotate keys, these use
cases should be handled without an exit/entry to avoid clogging
â€¢ Stereum launcher : beacon chain client installer, supports 4 clients
Layer2
â€¢ Optimism adds custom ERC20 token deposit and withdrawals
â€¢ Nova : trustless relaying of contract calls between L2 and L1, deployed on Optimism and mainnet, restricted to approved projects for now
â€¢ Hop enables fast exits from Optimism to mainnet for USDC and USDT, avoids 7 day optimistic rollup withdrawal time
â€¢ Loopring zkRollup NFTs : mint, trade and transfer on L2, deposit to L2, withdraw to L1, supports ERC721 and ERC1155
â€¢ L2Beat adds risk view : security, data availability, what can be changed and what to do on censorship or system goes offline
This newsletter is made possible thanks to Streamr !
The Streamr Network is being built to provide a decentralized real-time messaging protocol for web3. The network is a decentralized,
topic-based publish-subscribe system. Each stream or pub-sub topic has its own P2P overlay network that is built and maintained by a set
of BitTorrent-like trackers.
Testnets for the current Brubeck milestone of the network are now running. Contribute your idle bandwidth and run a node in the Streamr
Network to earn rewards, with 2M DATA tokens up for grabs! DATA is an ERC-20 token, currently trading on most major exchanges, that will
power the tokenomics mechanism on the Streamr Network. Learn how to run a Streamr node here .
For more information about the project, you can talk to the team on the Streamr Discord server !
Stuff for developers
â€¢ Ganache v7.0.0 alpha : local blockchain (formerly ganache-cli), significantly faster and more memory efficient, can run in browser
â€¢ Remix tools in VSCode : compile, deploy to public chains with MetaMask and debug with Remix's Debugger
â€¢ Modern ERC20 implementation using Solidity over/under flow checks
â€¢ Anton Bukovâ€™s Cumulative Merkle Tree drop , currently being audited
â€¢ opensea.rs : Rust CLI for OpenSea, supports Flashbots bundles, so orders don't get frontrun
â€¢ Etherscan Transaction Decoder : single view of emitted events, state difference and execution trace
â€¢ Etherscan adds verified contract name to creation transaction
â€¢ Deep dive of on chain SVG NFT examples
â€¢ ShadowySuperCoder NFT and infrastructure discounts for 100k addresses that deployed 1 or more contracts on mainnet (Disclosure: I
claimed)
Security
â€¢ OpenZeppelin Contracts TimelockController had security vulnerability, actor with executor role could escalate privileges, projects
should migrate to TimelockController in v4.3.1
â€¢ SushiSwap paid $1 million bounty to samczsun for Miso vulnerability disclosure where $350 million was at risk and assistance with
mitigation
Ecosystem
â€¢ Guide to EIP1559 gas fee calculations , explains base fee, priority fee and max fee (per gas)
â€¢ Leveraged sandwiching using flash swaps
â€¢ Discussion on need for a multi-chain ethereum provider
â€¢ Impersonator : log in to dapps impersonating any address via WalletConnect
â€¢ Vitalik: alternatives to selling NFTs at below market prices to avoid selling out quickly and gas market spikes
Enterprise
â€¢ Visa buys CryptoPunk and shares NFT whitepaper
â€¢ Head of Gaming at YouTube: Play-to-earn next major gaming model along with open market for in-game digital items
â€¢ Budweiser buys Beer.eth and changes profile picture to rocket ship NFT
Application layer
â€¢ ENS DNS namespace integration : domain name owners can import domains (such as weekinethereumnews.com) for use on ENS
â€¢ Lyra : native options trading on Optimism rollup, starting with single ETH market and liquidity provided by LyraDAO
â€¢ DAI peg mechanics explainer of Vault mechanism, DAI saving rate and Peg Stability Module
â€¢ Uniswap interactive math demos
â€¢ Jonathan Mann deploys NFT with on chain song
â€¢ Simon de la Rouviere: NFT fiction, top down vs bottom up
Regulation/business/tokens
â€¢ USDC reserves derisking to cash and short duration US Treasuries
â€¢ VanEck and ProShares not proceeding with Ethereum ETFs
â€¢ Paypal launches crypto services in UK to buy, hold and sell cryptocurrency
â€¢ a16z token delegation open sourced : best practices, criteria for assessing delegates and legal mechanics and template docs
â€¢ ETH daily issuance lower than BTCs for first time due to EIP1559 and NFT activity
General
â€¢ ðŸŽ‚ Week in Ethereum News turned 5, first issue was August 21, 2016
â€¢ Gartner : NFTs are at the peak of inflated expectations but DeFi has plenty of room for hype growth
â€¢ Analysis of cross chain bridges : security model, incentives and limitations
â€¢ Snowden: Apple declared war on iPhone users privacy
Job Listings
â€¢ Futureswap is hiring a Product Marketing Manager
â€¢ Vac (Status) is looking for a smart contracts protocol engineer for Waku
â€¢ Trail of Bits: Blockchain Security Apprenticeship
â€¢ Solidity is hiring a C++ dev
â€¢ Nethermind internship program
Want to reach people experienced with Ethereum? List your job here. $345 per line (~75 character limit including spaces), payable in ETH
(or 345 DAI or 345 USDC) to abcoathup.eth. Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @evan_van_ness and @abcoathup to get most of the weekâ€™s news in
real time.
Permalink for this weekâ€™s issue: https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-august-28-2021/
Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note (new/changes in bold ) :
â€¢ Sep 2 â€“ Prater testnet upgrade to Altair (epoch 36660)
â€¢ Sep 8Â â€“ Gitcoin Grants Round 11 starts
â€¢ Sep 15-17 â€“ MetaCartel MCON Denver
â€¢ Sep 17-Oct 15 â€“ ETHOnline hackathon
â€¢ Oct 1-3 â€“ EthAtlanta enterprise-focused hackathon & keynotes
â€¢ Oct 20-21 - LisCon (Lisbon)
â€¢ Oct 22-24 â€“ ETH Lisbon hackathon

Week in Ethereum News
